Name: App
Responsibility: The root component that orchestrates the entire application layout and state.
PerformanceNote: Must handle initial load efficiently, lazy load modules.
NamingRationale: 'App' is the universally understood single-word term for the primary application container.

Name: theme
Responsibility: Provides a single source of truth for all design tokens (colors, typography, spacing, etc.) to ensure UI consistency.
PerformanceNote: Should be a static object, no computation. Tree-shakable.
NamingRationale: 'theme' is the standard single-word for a design system's style object.

Name: Icon
Responsibility: Renders a specific SVG icon based on a `name` prop, decoupling icon assets from components that use them.
PerformanceNote: Uses React.lazy for dynamic import, so icons are only loaded on demand, reducing initial bundle size.
NamingRationale: 'Icon' is the direct, single-word representation of a graphical symbol.

Name: Button
Responsibility: A versatile button component supporting different variants, sizes, and states, with optional prefix/suffix icons.
PerformanceNote: Styled-component creation has a minor overhead; variants are optimized with `css` helper.
NamingRationale: 'Button' is the fundamental, single-word term for a clickable UI element.

Name: Card
Responsibility: A container component that displays content with a configurable shadow to create elevation.
PerformanceNote: The `box-shadow` property can be performance-intensive; transitions are included.
NamingRationale: 'Card' is a standard term for self-contained UI surfaces.

Name: Typography
Responsibility: A module providing a set of components (Title, Subtitle, Text) for rendering text with consistent, theme-driven styles.
PerformanceNote: Inheritance in styled-components is used to minimize style duplication.
NamingRationale: 'Typography' as a module and semantic names (Title, Text) for components provide clear context.

Name: adapter
Responsibility: Encapsulates all external libraries (React, Styled-Components, etc.) and exposes a consistent, single-word API to the application.
PerformanceNote: This is a crucial performance and maintenance pattern. It centralizes external dependencies, allowing for easier upgrades or swaps.
NamingRationale: 'adapter' is the standard term for a structural pattern that allows incompatible interfaces to work together.
